abstract: Carl C. Icahn, after a very public campaign against Time Warner last year, during which he attacked its chief executive and tried to force a break up of the company, now apparently has other fish to fry. Mr. Icahn and his Icahn Management affiliate have dumped about 44 million shares of the media company over the course of the fourth quarter, according to a Wednesday filing with the Security and Exchange Commission quarterly filing.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn, after a very public campaign against Time Warner last year, during which he attacked its chief executive and tried to force a break up of the company, now apparently has other fish to fry. Mr. Icahn and his Icahn Management affiliate have dumped about 44 million shares of the media company over the course of the fourth quarter, according to a Wednesday filing with the Security and Exchange Commission quarterly filing.
